title: Is Tiruvallur a part of Chennai? - Quora

response.answer_text: Tiruvallur is a district of Tamil Nadu. It's close proximity to Chennai city(West) has made it look like a part of Chennai metropolitan area. Some parts of Tiruvallur district like Avadi, Madhavaram, Ponneri, Manali, Puzhal, Cholavaram and etc. are under Chennai Metropolitan agglomeration. Tiruvallur town is just 5- 10 kms away from the urban Chennai area. Metropolitan transport Corporation - Chennai(MTC) offers frequent bus service from Koyambedu, Avadi, Madhavaram, T.Nagar, Poonamallee (Poovirundhavalli) to Tiruvallur town( 153A , S597 etc.). Tiruvallur is a fast growing town now as it is near the Metro agglomeration of Chennai. Soon many parts of the district including Tiruvallur town will be annexed within the Metro area of Chennai.

Nope.But The Chennai's Most of Manufacturing sector industries are in the limits of Tiruvallur district which is part of Greater Chennai Metropolitan 💥 So the GDP of Chennai City also lower(which only measured core city alone )
